Definition:Â  IMO
An
independent medical opinion (IMO)
, as discussed in
38 CFR 3.328
, is
a type of advisory medical opinion that may be obtained from one or more recognized medical experts who are
not
VA employees, and
only warranted in connection with
claims of significant medical complexity and/or controversy, and/or
fulfillment of instructions contained in a remand order from the Board of Veterans Appeals (BVA).
Note
:
As discussed in
M21-1, Part IV, Subpart i, 2.E.5.d
, VA Central Office has the responsibility for deciding if the IMO is warranted.
